definition: to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony

sentences.english: The fire was warm, however, and the nursery dimly lit by three night-lights, and presently the sewing lay on Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 炉火暖融融的，育儿室里半明半暗地点着三盏夜灯。

sentences.english: The days are warm and sunny…
sentences.chinese: 每天都暖融融的，充满阳光。

sentences.english: Come into the warmth of the Fortnum and Mason tearoom .
sentences.chinese: 走进福特南和梅森商店暖融融的茶室。

sentences.english: She gently asked, smiling as her heart began to fill with warmth.
sentences.chinese: 她微笑着轻声问道，内心感到暖融融的。

sentences.english: Our faces warm in the early sun.
sentences.chinese: 朝阳暖融融地照在我们脸上。

sentences.english: The event was really happy, nice and warm sun bathed.
sentences.chinese: 这次活动真的很开心，沐浴着暖融融的阳光。

sentences.english: A welcoming fire was burning in the fireplace.
sentences.chinese: 壁炉里燃烧着暖融融的炉火。

sentences.english: She was very glad of her warm coat in the biting wind.
sentences.chinese: 在刺骨的寒风中她有暖融融的大衣真是谢天谢地。

sentences.english: The sun warmed up the earth nicely.
sentences.chinese: 太阳把大地照得暖融融的。

sentences.english: May this Valentine bless us with the cupid of love and warmth of romance.
sentences.chinese: 愿情人节带给我们丘比特之爱和暖融融的浪漫。

definition: Nuannuan district of Keelung City 基隆市[Ji1 long2 shi4], Taiwan
variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
